Package pl.polsl.lab.bartosz.sosnica.sudoku.model

Class BoardModel

java.lang.Object
pl.polsl.lab.bartosz.sosnica.sudoku.model.BoardModel
public class BoardModel extends Object
The BoardModel class represents the model of the Sudoku board. It handles the board setup, placement of values, validation of moves, and difficulty level management. It also provides methods to manipulate the board state and check for validity of player moves.
Version:
3.0
Author:
Bartosz So≈õnica

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardModel

      public BoardModel()

  • Method Details

    • settingUpBoard

      public void settingUpBoard()
      Initializes the board with empty cells represented by an empty string. The board is a 9x9 grid, with each cell initially empty.

    • changeStatus

      public void changeStatus()
      Changes the status of the board to "Solved". This method is called when the player successfully completes the Sudoku puzzle.

    • placeValue

      public void placeValue(int row, int col, String value)
      Places a value at the specified row and column on the board. If the provided value is null, an empty string is placed instead.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0-based).
      col - the column index (0-based).
      value - the value to place in the specified cell.

    • validateValueUniqueness

      public void validateValueUniqueness(int row, int col, String value) throws InvalidSudokuMoveException
      Validates if the specified value is unique across the specified row and column. If the value is already present in the row or column, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0-based).
      col - the column index (0-based).
      value - the value to validate.
      Throws:
      InvalidSudokuMoveException - if the value already exists in the row or column.

    • settingDifficultyLevel

      public void settingDifficultyLevel(BoardModel.DifficultyLevel level)
      Sets the difficulty level and calculates the number of cells to remove based on the level.
      Parameters:
      level - the difficulty level (Easy, Medium, Hard).

    • checkMultipleValues

      public void checkMultipleValues(String... values)
      Validates multiple values using a variable number of parameters. Each value must be a single digit (1-9), otherwise an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      values - the values to validate.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any value is invalid (not a single digit).

    • removeValue

      public void removeValue(int row, int col)
      Removes a value from the specified row and column on the board, setting it to an empty string. This method is used to reset a cell to its initial state.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index (0-based).
      col - the column index (0-based).
